intro: Hieracium densilimbatum, commonly known as the dense-limbed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in summer, producing achenes that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium densilimbatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
